programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Last spring, Steve decided to pass up an opportunity to kill a black bear in favor of an extended up close and personal experience. This time, Steve heads back to his shack on Prince of Wales Island and he‚Äôs brought his friend Paul Neess from Vortex Optics along to share the experience of using a canoe to slip in close to these giant black bears.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve is fascinated by indigenous people who live in the wilds South America. In this three-part series, he travels deep into the Amazon jungle to hunt with and learn from the locals there. Not only will this be one heck of a hunting adventure, it will be a mind-opening, life-changing event. From bowfishing to hunting in the jungle at night, you never know what the evening‚Äôs menu will bring.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella has hunted this area before, but he feels he‚Äôs just scratched the surface exploring the surrounding country. The top of the mountain is always calling Steve‚Äôs name, and for this serious Alaskan backpack hunt he‚Äôs bringing along comedians Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen. Cold, wet weather and tough hunting for wily Sitka deer make this a southeast Alaskan adventure these hunters will never forget.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Dropped off by bushplane on a remote lakeside in the wilderness of Alaska‚Äôs Brooks Range, Steven Rinella and wildlife biologist Brandt Meixell have ten days of hunting before the plane returns. Big-antlered Yukon moose are few and far between but hard work pays off for hunters who stick with it until the bitter end.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: The goal on MeatEater has always been to make viewers feel like they‚Äôre on a hunt with Steven Rinella, but on this two-part episode Rinella grants his viewers an all-access pass to see just how the MeatEater crew works together to make the show. Strap-in for some behind-the-scenes action.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella takes to the canyons of the West Texas desert in search of javelina. In this broken, rocky terrain finding these unique critters isn't easy and getting a clear shot on a skunk pig with a bow is a whole other story. But Steve is inspired by the evidence of he finds of ancient hunters that used the area to prepare a meal that honors both the animal and our hunting ancestors.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: Bin Laden's Triple Threat
programme.desc: He is the most dangerous triple-agent in US history. He duped the United States for more than a decade, serving in the US Military, FBI, and CIA, while simultaneously helping orchestrate the al Qaeda campaign of terror that led to 9/11. Plus, a decorated four-star Army General resigns amidst scandal.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: Continuing her journey through Emilia-Romagna, Nadia makes two classics of the region: Gnocchi Fritti and Lasagna Verde. She learns all about Italian cured meats at Salumi Grossetti and Parmigiano Reggiano at La Cappelletta. She learns that if you pay attention to all the details, then you will always end up with perfection.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: As her culinary tour of Emilia-Romagna comes to a close, Nadia explores some of the region's decadent delicacies to make surprisingly simple dishes: Tagliolini al Tartufo and Pizza e Fichi. Since The Pasta Queen always cooks with the freshest ingredients, she travels to Valsamoggia to learn how to hunt for truffles before stopping in Langhirano to learn all about Prosciutto Di Parma.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: The region of Emilia-Romagna is home to the most well-known ingredients in Italian cuisine. Nadia travels into the heart of Bologna to learn how to make Tortellini and then to Modena to learn the process of making Balsamic Vinegar with Michelin Star Chef Massimo Bottura. Using a few potatoes and some modified poultry, Nadia highlights how this region is the capital of food and a force of nature!
